bibl.title: P.Col. inv. 33r and the Processing of Data in Early Roman Egypt.
Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall

bibl.note: Arsinoitês, May 6-25, 232. Fragment of a register of letters sent to two different epitêrêtai with regional competence in the Polemôn and Themistos merides, probably sent by the joint stratêgos of the two merides.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Col. Inv. 33 recto = P. Bagnall 70
Uri Yiftach-Firanko, P.Col. inv. 33r and the Processing of Data in Early Roman Egypt.

Rodney Ast, Hélène Cuvigny, Todd M. Hickey & Julia Lougovaya (edd.), Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall = American Studies in Papyrology. 53 (Durham, North Carolina, 2013) pp. 349-354, 1 fig.

Arsinoitês, May 6-25, 232. Fragment of a register of letters sent to two different epitêrêtai with regional competence in the Polemôn and Themistos merides, probably sent by the joint stratêgos of the two merides.
